eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Bouh, @arthuro555
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Clipboard
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: This extension allows to access the clipboard.

eventsFunctions.description:
Read the text from the clipboard asynchronously. 

Note also that on web browsers, the user might be asked for permissions to read from the clipboard.
eventsFunctions.name: AsynchronouslyReadTextCrossPlaform
eventsFunctions.sentence: Read clipboard and store text in _PARAM1_

inlineCode: const logger = this.logger || (this.logger = new gdjs.Logger("Clipboard extension"));
logger.error("An error occured while getting clipboard content: ", error);
logger.error("An error occured while getting clipboard content: ", error.message);
logger.error("Unable to read from the clipboard: no method found for this platform.");

parameters.description: Callback variable where to store the clipboard contents
parameters.name: callback

eventsFunctions.description: Write the text in the clipboard.
eventsFunctions.name: WriteText

inlineCode: else console.error("Unable to write to the clipboard: no method found for this platform.");

eventsFunctions.description:
Read the text from the clipboard asynchronously. As this is "asynchronous", the variable won't be immediately filled with the text from the clipboard. You will have to wait a few frames before it will be. If you want your subsequent actions and subevents to automatically wait for the read to finish, use the waiting version of this action instead (recomended). 

Note also that on web browsers, the user might be asked for permissions to read from the clipboard.
eventsFunctions.fullName: (No waiting) Get text from the clipboard
eventsFunctions.name: ReadTextCrossPlaform
eventsFunctions.sentence: Read clipboard and store text in _PARAM1_

inlineCode: console.error("Error occured while getting clipboard content: ", err.message)
} else console.error("Unable to read from the clipboard: no method found for this platform.")

parameters.description: Callback variable where to store the result
parameters.name: callback

eventsFunctions.description: [DEPRECATED] Read the text from the clipboard (Windows, macOS, Linux only)
eventsFunctions.fullName: [DEPRECATED] Get text from the clipboard (Windows, macOS, Linux)
eventsFunctions.name: ReadText

events.comment: This is here for retrocompatibility. Try to use the AsynchronouslyReadTextCrossPlatform action instead.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Lizard-13
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SnapToGrid
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Snap objects on a virtual grid.
description: It allows to snap objects on a *virtual grid*.
It's useful for:
- level editors
- building systems
A [simple example](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://snap-object-to-grid) shows how to snap objects that are dragged with the mouse.

eventsFunctions.description: Snap object to a virtual grid (i.e: this is not the grid used in the editor).
eventsFunctions.fullName: Snap objects to a virtual grid
eventsFunctions.name: SnapObjectToVirtualGrid
eventsFunctions.sentence: Snap _PARAM1_ to a virtual grid using cells with width: _PARAM2_px, height _PARAM3_px and an offset position (_PARAM4_; _PARAM5_)

events.comment: Round the Object position to snap to the in-game grid

parameters.description: Objects to snap to the virtual grid
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: Width of a cell of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: CellWidth

parameters.description: Height of a cell of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: CellHeight

parameters.description: Offset on the X axis of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: OffsetX

parameters.description: Offset on the Y axis of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: OffsetY

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CameraZoom
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allows to zoom camera on a layer with a speed (factor per second).
description: ## Description

This extension allows to zoom a camera on a layer at a given speed. The zoom speed is configurable and allows a constant as well as a variable zoom speed. An anchor point can be defined, for instance, to keep what is under the cursor at the same place on screen.
### Actions
- Zoom at a given speed
- Change the zoom with an anchor point
- Zoom at a given speed and with an anchor point

eventsFunctions.description: Change the camera zoom at a given speed (in factor per second).
eventsFunctions.name: ZoomWithSpeed

parameters.longDescription: Zoom by a factor per second. 1: no effect, 2: zoom in x2 every second, 0.5: zoom out x2 every second.
parameters.name: ZoomSpeed

eventsFunctions.description: Change the camera zoom and keep an anchor point fixed on screen (instead of the center).
eventsFunctions.name: ZoomWithAnchor
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change camera zoom to: _PARAM1_ with an anchor at: _PARAM4_; _PARAM5_ (layer: _PARAM2_, camera: _PARAM3_)

events.comment:
When zooming the vector in pixels from the center to the anchor must stay the same.
It gives this system:

/ pixel_delta(t-1) = (anchor - center(t-1)) * zoom(t-1)
| pixel_delta(t) = (anchor - center(t)) * zoom(t)
\ pixel_delta(t) = pixel_delta(t-1)

where the new center can be resolved to:

center(t) = anchor + (center(t-1) - anchor) * zoom(t-1) / zoom(t)

parameters:
GetArgumentAsNumber("AnchorX")
+ (
   CameraX(GetArgumentAsString("Layer"), GetArgumentAsNumber("Camera"))
   - GetArgumentAsNumber("AnchorX")
)
* CameraZoom(GetArgumentAsString("Layer"), GetArgumentAsNumber("Camera"))
/ GetArgumentAsNumber("Zoom")

GetArgumentAsNumber("AnchorY")
+ (
   CameraY(GetArgumentAsString("Layer"), GetArgumentAsNumber("Camera"))
   - GetArgumentAsNumber("AnchorY")
)
* CameraZoom(GetArgumentAsString("Layer"), GetArgumentAsNumber("Camera"))
/ GetArgumentAsNumber("Zoom")

parameters.longDescription: 1: Initial zoom, 2: zoom in x2, 0.5: zoom out x2...
parameters.name: Zoom

eventsFunctions.description: Change the camera zoom at a given speed (in factor per second) and keep an anchor point fixed on screen (instead of the center).
eventsFunctions.fullName: Zoom camera with speed and anchor
eventsFunctions.name: ZoomWithSpeedAndAnchor
eventsFunctions.sentence: Zoom camera with speed: _PARAM1_ and an anchror at: _PARAM4_; _PARAM5_ (layer: _PARAM2_, camera: _PARAM3_)

parameters.longDescription: Zoom by a factor per second. 1: no effect, 2: zoom in x2 every second, 0.5: zoom out x2 every second.
parameters.name: ZoomSpeed

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @ddabrahim
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Drag camera with the mouse (or touchscreen)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DragCameraWithPointer
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move a camera by dragging the mouse (or touchscreen).
description: Move a camera by dragging the mouse (or touchscreen).
How to use:
- Run this action on every frame that you want the camera to be movable by the mouse (or touchscreen)
- Select the mouse button to use (choose "left" for touchscreen)
- Select which directions the camera will move (vertical, horizontal, or both)
- Select the layer that will be moved
Tips:
- If no parameters are selected, the camera will move in both directions when the left mouse button (or touchscreen) are dragged.

eventsFunctions.description: Move a camera by dragging the mouse (or touchscreen).
eventsFunctions.name: DragCameraWithPointer
eventsFunctions.sentence: Drag camera on layer _PARAM2_ in _PARAM3_ directions using _PARAM4_ mouse button

events.comment: When mouse button is pressed, get starting position of mouse
When mouse button is pressed, get current position of mouse and calculate distance between the previous and current position on X and Y axis
If selected direction is horizontal, both, or left blank, move camera on X axis
Only move camera when the distance is more than one pixel
If direction is vertical, both, or left blank, move camera on Y axis
Only move camera when the distance is more than one pixel

parameters.description: Directions that the camera can move (horizontal, vertical, both)
parameters.name: Direction

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CharacterGameFeel
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Add game feel to your platformer character object.
description: Add game feel behavior to your platformer character object to get the animations:
- **Idle:** gives your character breath animation while not moving.
- **Jump:** gives your character squash and stretch animation when jumping.
- **Fall:** gives your character stretch animation when falling.
- **Land:** gives your character squash and stretch animation when landing.
# Behavior
- Game feel behavior.
- Includes the options (Scale strength/Scaling speed) for every animation.
# Condition
- Animation is playing.
# Action
- Disable animation.
- Enable animation.
# Important
- Your sprite "origin" point, must be at the center bottom.
![](https://i.imgur.com/3Ggbm4h.png)
- Your sprite bottom collision, must be filled entirely.
![](https://i.imgur.com/0EYqreA.png)

events.comment: Boolean to check if the idle animation is unchecked in the behavior
Boolean to check if the idle animation is checked in the behavior
Tween the object to its normal scale if its moving
Tween the object to first step of breathing animation
Tween the object to the second step of breathing animation (scaling back to 1)
Repeat when the breath animation has finished (loop)
Boolean to check if the jump animation is unchecked in the behavior
Boolean to check if the jump animation is checked in the behavior
Tween the object to first step of jumping (squash)
Tween the object to second step of jumping (Stretch)
Tween back to object original scale
Boolean to give the ability to repeat after standing on floor
Boolean to check if the fall animation is unchecked in the behavior
Boolean to check if the fall animation is checked in the behavior
Stretch the object when falling
If the land animation is unchecked, Tween the object to its normal scale
If the land animation is checked, give the ability to do the fall animation again
If the land animation is unchecked, give the ability to do the fall animation again after the tween
Boolean to check if the fall animation is unchecked in the behavior
Boolean to check if the fall animation is checked in the behavior
Booleans to check if the object is landing
Squash the object when landing
Tween back to object original scale after squashing
Boolean to give the ability to do the land animation again

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object game feel animation is playing.
eventsFunctions.name: AnimationIsPlaying

propertyDescriptors.label: Idle animation
propertyDescriptors.description: Apply breath animation on the object.
propertyDescriptors.name: AIdleCheck

propertyDescriptors.label: Jump animation
propertyDescriptors.description: Apply squash and stretch animation on the object.
propertyDescriptors.name: FJumpCheck

propertyDescriptors.label: Fall animation
propertyDescriptors.description: Apply stretch animation on the object.
propertyDescriptors.name: IallCheck

propertyDescriptors.label: Land animation
propertyDescriptors.description: Apply squash animation on the object.
